SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.network

Interface ClientNetManager

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
RmiClientNetManager, SocketClientNetManager
public interface ClientNetManager extends Closeable
Client network entrypoint which allows to kick-start communications with the server.

Implementing classes provide a way to connect to the server with the given nickname and are in charge of maintaining the communication, updating the model as instructed by the server and cleaning up and notifying via the model once a connection is lost.

Entry-points are: - RmiClientNetManager.connect(String, int, String) which uses a protocol implemented on top of RMI - SocketClientNetManager.connect(InetSocketAddress, String) which uses a protocol implemented on top of raw sockets

      Ask the server to join a game

      The server is in charge of choosing the most appropriate lobby to put this player in.

      Returns:
      the lobby in which the server decided to put the player in

    • recreateAndReconnect

      ClientNetManager recreateAndReconnect() throws Exception
      Recreates the same kind of ClientNetManager as this and attempts to reconnect to the same server with the same nick
      Returns:
      newly reconnected ClientNetManager
      Throws:
      NickNotValidException - if the nick is already in use by another player
      Exception - implementation-specific connection exceptions
